manipulation.image.JPEG

Class Component

  • java.lang.Object
    • manipulation.image.JPEG.Component

  • public class Component
extends java.lang.Object
    Class which handles the Components of a JPEG image.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Component

        public Component(int scanType,
                 int componentID,
                 int componentHorizontalFactor,
                 int componentVerticalFactor,
                 int quantizationTableID)
        Constructor, creates a new component using the passed parameters.
        Parameters:
        scanType - the type of scan the JPEG file uses
        componentID - the id of the component
        componentHorizontalFactor - the horizontal sampling value
        componentVerticalFactor - the vertical sampling value
        quantizationTableID - the id of the quantization value used for the component

    • Method Detail

      • calPixelX

        public void calPixelX(int xMax)

        Calculates the amount of horizontal pixels a data unit spans

        Parameters:
        xMax - the maximum component horizontal sampling in the JPEG image

      • calPixelY

        public void calPixelY(int yMax)

        Calculates the amount of vertical pixels a data unit spans

        Parameters:
        yMax - the maximum component vertical sampling in the JPEG image

      • calMCU

        public void calMCU(int imageWidth,
                   int imageHeight)

        Calculates the amount of MCU's in a Non-Interleaved JPEG image.

        Parameters:
        imageWidth - the width of the image
        imageHeight - the height of the image

      • calMCUInterleaved

        public void calMCUInterleaved(int imageWidth,
                              int imageHeight,
                              int xMax,
                              int yMax)

        Calculates the amount of MCU's in a Interleaved JPEG image.

        Parameters:
        imageWidth - the width of the image
        imageHeight - the height of the image
        xMax - maximum horizontal sampling of all components in the image
        yMax - maximum vertical sampling of all components in the image
